intro: Avena ovata, commonly known as the slender oat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. Avena ovata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has been studied for its potential ecological and agricultural uses.
